quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ohhhh! She's absolutely adorable!

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.line: He.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: ...Oh, sorry. He's--he's dressed all in pink.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.line: That's his favorite color.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: ...Oh. That's... fun for him.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ohhh, wow. Look at that. How cute.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.line: Thank youuu.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ohh. May I?

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.line: Uh, sure!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [climbs under desk] Hey, look at me, I'm a baby! I'm one of those babies from "Look Who's Talking." What am I thinking? [Laughs] Look at all those staplers! What's a stapler!? I don't even know, I'm a baby! Hey, Mom, I'm thirsty! I'm thirsty, Mama! I want some milk. And you know where milk comes from! Breasts.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: ...Almost done?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Just about... yup. Now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes. I have started to see Karen. It's very new, and... not really ready to talk about it openly yet, just because, I think, once the word gets out there, it might affect the way people behave around us or... I dunno. Just, not yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, Jan, it um... looks like a check, piece of paper of some sort. Receipt. I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Jan, this is Angela Martin from accounting.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [over phone] Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Look, we have a rebate from... the Federal Work Opportunity Program and no one knows what that means.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: We get that money for hiring an ex-convict.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I didn't hire an ex-convict. Unless they mean Toby. Convicted rapist. [Jan sighs] ... I'm just kidding.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: When did the check come?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Last week.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Okay, that's when the branches merged, so Josh must have been taking advantage of this program. Smart move.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: One of the Stamford people is a criminal?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey Jan, speaking of Stamford, Hannah brought in her baby.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Jan, which one of the new employees is a criminal?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Uh, reformed convict, and, uh, I'm not sure. Though hang on, let me email our HR, stay on the line.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [whispering] Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hannah?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hmm. Martin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Kuhhhh... you are such a racist.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Wait, why am I a racist?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because you think he's black.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: He is black... right? And...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Stop it. Stop it right-stop it right now.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: ...Okay it's someone named Martin Nash.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why did the convict have to be a black guy? It is such a stereotype. I just wish that Josh had made a more progressive choice. Like a white guy... who went to prison for... polluting a black guy's lake.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I wonder what he did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: In our society, a black man can be arrested for almost anything. He was probably at a sporting event and... saw some people pushing each other, and he intervened.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Why would anyone go to jail for that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sssssso, what we need to do... is to forget about this whole Martin in prison thing. People will draw unfair conclusions about Martin and or black people.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay. Angela?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Sure. Let's protect the convicts. At the expense of the general feeling of safety in the workplace. As a 90-pound female that sits in an ill-lit, rarely-visited corner of the office, naturally I agree with that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good. All right. [everyone leaves]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [picks up phone] Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [over phone] I am so horny.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: ...Okay I can't... help you... with that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, I think you can, Big Tuna. Tell me about that Indian chick, Kelly. She seems pretty slutty. Good for a romp in the sack.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: She is dating Ryan, I think.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, and I care why?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: She's... high-maintenance.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Next. How about... [motions toward Angela]. Blondes are more fun. C'mon, trust me on that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, trust me, that would be fun for no one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okay fine. Um. Pam, the receptionist. Paaam. Should I go for it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: ...Absolutely you should.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Jackpot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Just... try to be cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I am cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, are you cool, really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm cool, I'm cool, I'm so cool. Tell me what is going on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um... Martin, from Stamford, was, at one time, in prison. [Dwight starts to run] No. Dwight! Be cool! Be cool!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I am greatly concerned about having a convict in the office. And I do not care if that convict is white, black, Asian, German, or some kind of halfsy. I do not like criminals.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: All... righty, let's get started. What is she into?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I know Pam pretty well. I know the things that she likes, and, just as important, I know the things that she hates. So, one of the things that she likes is pranks. And, the things that she hates...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Frisbee-based competitions...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: She...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I started the main Frisbee golf club at Cornell. Where I went to college. I live to frolf.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Lead off with that. She loves hunting. She also loves those ads for Six Flags, with the old guy. [Andy hums Six Flag ad] Got it. Also... do you speak pig latin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey Martin, how's it going?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: Good. Getting settled, you know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah. Good good. Good. Just a second. Everybody? May I have your attention please? I realize that a lot of you have already heard that Martin here has had some trouble with the law, but I just want to declare publicly that I... trust... him, completely, and that anybody who doesn't is an ignorant, dumb... person. Okay? As a matter of fact, you show me a white man you trust and I will show you a black man that I trust even more. Pam. Tell me a white person you trust.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: My dad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...Danny Glover. [Jim raises hand] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Jonas Salk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Who?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Justin Timberlake?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh. Please. Colin Powell.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Hey I got one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Jesus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Apollo Creed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Close your eyes. Picture a convict. What's he wearing? Nothing special, baseball cap on backwards, baggy pants... he says something ordinary like... 'yo, thats shizzle.' Okay. Now slowly open your eyes again. Who are you picturing? A black man? Wrong. That was a white woman. Surprised? Well, shame on you.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: So... you all wanna know what I was in for?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. That's not cool. You don't have to tell them.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: Um, I really don't mind. It was a stupid mistake. I was working in finance and, I... got involved in some insider trading. So, I spent a little time in the clink.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughs] That is awesome.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I had Martin explain to me three times what he got arrested for, because... it sounds an awful lot like what I do here every day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What was prison like?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: Not terrible. Boring. We do the same thing every day. But... at least we got outdoors time.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You got outdoors time?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: Two hours, every day. Sometimes we'd play pickup football games...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael, why don't we get outdoors time?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, some days I never go outside.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, we are running a business, so.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: What was your cell like?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: Not good. Uh... a little bit bigger than Michael's office... but, you know, I really only slept there. You know, during the day, there-our time's our own. They had uh, classes, I took some... watercolor classes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: They have art classes?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: Yeap. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: They have business classes there?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: They did, taught by some uh, Harvard business school guys--a lot of the guys also, that were in the class, the inmates, a lot of them have gone on to do extraordinary things in business.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Kinda sounds like... prison's... better than Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah. Well. That's not true.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I would so rather be in prison.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Prison sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No you would not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This place is not prison. It's... way better than prison.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [singsong voice] Baby. Hello baby. Here you want to play with this?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: You can't give paperclips to a baby. He could swallow.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Oh, it's okay. I've got tons of them. You like that? Goo-goo-goo-goo?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Pam-a-lama-ding-dong. Listen, you're cute. There is no gettin' around it. So... I don't know if you like country music, but I was thinking maybe one of these days we could drive out to a field, crank up some tunes, smoke a few Macanudos... maybe even toss a disk around.  Utway ooday ooyay inkthay, Ampay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow... I--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Shh. Think about it. I'll hit you back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow. That was... wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay! Listen up everybody! Um, you guys said that prison was better than this place, and I heard ya, loud and clear, so, I am instituting some changes to make this more like prison. We are going to start with an hour of outdoor time. So let's go!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael, it's freezing out.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I can't feel my toes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why don't we... pump some iron? Anyone wanna... pump up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What is that, like... five pounds?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's uh... two and a half. I'm not going for bulk, I'm going for tone.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm going back inside.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, it's... freaking cold out here. Anybody wants to stay out, you've got about... twenty-seven minutes of rec time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh heyyy. Martiiin. You have TV in the joint?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: Yeah, in the rec room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah. A ten inch black and white?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: Actually, our TV was bigger than that one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: These people don't realize how lucky they are. This office is the American Dream. And they would rather be in the hole.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh. Andy. I thought of one last tact you can take with Pam.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Quick question - do you play the guitar?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I play the banjo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hold on, let me think about that, yes, that'll work. But can you sing in a sexy high falsetto voice?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [singing] You know I can, my man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yup. That's perfect.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'm gonna go get my banjo out of my car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: ...I'm messing with Andy. I'm sending him to all the women in the office with... just... terrible information on how to get them to go out with him.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: I love it. I want in. Who's the target?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: ...Oh, you know what? ... It was... gonna be Pam, but...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Perfect. What do I do? Just give me an assignment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, you know what though? I feel like I already sicked him on Pam... we'll give her a break. Let's think of someone else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right everybody, there has been a lot of name calling against our office today. Corporate maligning, slurring, much of it coming from one of you, who claims that prison is better... than... here. And none of can say "Boo" because none of us have ever been to prison. Well, there's somebody I'd like you to meet. Somebody else who has been to prison, who can tell you what it is really like [puts on bandanna]. I'm prison Mike! You know why they call me prison Mike?!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Do you really expect us to believe you're somebody else?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you really expect me to not push you up against the wall, beeyotch?! [employees protest] All right, hey, hey, hey, hey, that's just the way we talk in the clink. Been a lot of fun talk about prison today, but I am here to scare you straight. I AM HERE TO SCARE YOU STRAIIIGHT!! In prison you are somebody's bitch. Oh, and you. [points to Ryan] You, my friend, would be da belle of da ball. Don't drop the soap! Don't drop the soap!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Michael, please. [Michael makes kissing noises]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Where... did you learn all of this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Internet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So, not prison.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And prison. Eh, fifty-fifty, both. Look, prison stinks, is what I'm saying. It's not like you can go home, and, recharge your batteries, and come back in the morning and, be with your friends, having fun in the office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What'd you do, Prison Mike?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I stole. ... And I robbed. And I kidnapped... the... president's son. And held him for ransom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That is... quite the rap sheet, Prison Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And I nevah got caught, neither.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, you're... in... prison, but, mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Prison Mike? What was the food like in prison?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Gruel. Sandwiches. Gruel omelettes. Nothing but gruel. Plus, you can eat your own hair.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Wow. Prison sounds horrible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. Yeah. Well, thank you, Andy. Tanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Prison Mike. What's the very very worst thing about prison?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Don't encourage him, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The worst thing about prison was the... was the Dementors. They... were flying all over the place, and they were scary. And they'd come down, and they'd suck the soul out of your body, and it hurt!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Demen-Dementors like in Harry Potter?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, not Harry Potter. ... There are no movies in prison. This is my point! You guys got it soft, and cushy! This place is freaking awesome! The people are awesome! Your boss is nice! Everyone seems to get along! People are tolerant! People who... have jumped to conclusions can redeem themselves! Nobody is nobody's bitch. I hope that this scared you. And from me, Prison Mike, to you, I just wanna thank you for listening to me. Letting me be a part of your life today. 'Cause you got a good life! YOu got a good life. A good life. [turns around, takes bandanna off] So. What do you think? It doesn't sound so great, does it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow. Thank you. Um, that must have been hard for you to relive that. Both of you.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.line: Yeah, that... wasn't really... at all my experience. There were certain elements of what you performed, I've seen on television. But it didn't remind me of my time in prison.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. Okay, fine. You guys think prison is so great? All right. Well, here you go. [locks employees in conference room]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, Michael. Come on. Let us out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No! If you think is prison is so wonderful, then, enjoy prison! They are such babies. I am going to leave them in there until they can appreciate what it's like to have freedom. And if this doesn't bother them, then I am out of ideas.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [knocking on door] Hey! Let us out of here! Hey! I have--

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.line: Shh!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [answering phone] This is Toby. Hey Pam. Where are you calling from?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Michael. Why's everyone locked in the conference room?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: They were very disrespectful to me, and to the office. And Martin has had a bad influence, to think that I gave him the benefit of the doubt.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, you're going to have to let 'em out. Or... or I will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. You know what Toby? I am teaching them a lesson, so.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You know they're teasing you. I mean... obviously, this is... a much nicer place than an actual prison. We get paid to be here. We go home afterwards and have social lives. We have... we have parties here. They're teasing you. To be funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [unlocks door] Okay nutcases, get out of there! Good work. Long day. Really long. Why don't you guys head home. Early. Time off for good behavior! Heh. Good job. Enjoy your freedoms!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Martin went from being a new guy from Stamford... to a convict, to... my friend. Back to a convict. Then to... a kind of a nuisance, actually, to be completely honest. And finally, to... a quitter. And I will not miss him. And that is not because he is black.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [singing] So we've been told, and some choose to believe it, I know they're wrong, wait and see, 'cause one day we'll find it, the ainbowray onnectionkay, the lovers, the dreamers, and meeee...
